review: Marilu is the best bartender in all of the Antelope Valley, the service is outstanding . Marilu always recommends other items and asks if you want more fries  January 14, 2018 Marilu is an excellent bar tender, and is a main reason I come here, she is a very pleasant person and a great conversationist
Always enjoy the unlimited (bottomless) steak fries. The burgers are also good, however, i enjoy the cod and chips more. The place does get crowded, which tends to show a good meal.

My family and I ate here on 8/18 and I am allergic to eggs and chicken, poultry so I hate to eat out but I gave in to eat here and our waitress Shannon was very helpful and she was the best, I would definitely recommend her. To my surprise, a very nice surprise the restaurant has a list of things on a tablet where they show you you can pick what you can have that doesn't have egg or whatever else you might be allergic to and this is the first time I've ever seen this in any place I've ever been. The Manager, she was very nice and helpful also.  Thank you
I give this place 5 stars for fast service during a busy time of year and I really have no complaints ‍

This was the worst experience I had at red robin. The beer cheese for the pretzel bites was curdled. The bacon was the precooked microwavable bacon. Plus the server touch the inside of the cup my fiancee was drinking out of with her fingers. We received no silverware and had to ask for it AFTER our appetizers and entree came. Then when we paid to leave the server was adamant to have us talk to the manager and would not take no thank you for an answer. She then cursed under her breath and walked away only to turn around and glare at us until we left the establishment. We tried to walk away peacefully and leave peacefully.  After this happened three of us who had literally one bite of the curdled cheese became sick. The f oid wad horrible and made my daughter cry!
Be careful using credit or debit cards here my wife and I had our card info stolen just before Christmas here and the person that stole it bought iTunes gift cards with it. So just be careful!!!!!

What can I say? Other than the fact that the customer service is horrid. The hostesses have terrible attitudes, they do not seat tables in sequential order. Everything is an excuse. We were lied to about when my party would be sat, and when we talked to the manager, she honestly blew smoke up our asses. We will not be returning. Way to ruin a family outing.
This time service was fast and on top of it.  I was very happy. The food was good. No long wait.  It's was tasty hot & grubbing.  This time I'm very happy with this trip to the bird.

I came in for a few drinks and a bite to eat and was pretty disappointed. All the bathroom stalls were dirty, some of the bathroom doors don't lock. The menu items appear to be multiple variations of the same items just put in different places to make it seem like there is more on the menu. The cocktail list is similar and all very unappealing. I have nothing good nor bad to say about the food we ended up ordering, it was honestly forgettable. The restaurant was not very busy yet there appeared to only be one employee actually working. That was our server Bobby who was also tending the bar and almost every occupied table while trhe rest of the employees we saw just walked around. Bobby was extremely polite and personable and hard working and attentive. The service was really the thing that made the experience ok and not a complete disappointment. In my opinion this location just isn't really trying and should do better.

Red Robin is amazing! I love the food and the drinks.  The ambiance is always something to stare at. Red Robin has very vintage pictures, that cover from the celling to the floor.  I am vegetarian, the I always get the veggie patty. I get the Veggie patty with a sunny side up egg, tomato, lettuces, with guacamole, on wheat bread.  & as a bonus the fires are amazing!  The service is cool too. I never had a mean or rude waitress/ waiter. You need to always ask for more fires though. They never offer to give you a second on your bottomless fries.

This location is actually pretty amazing.  I like to believe you get what you pay for but here you pay surprisingly low prices and get exceptional customer service. It almost does't seem fair! With that said, they have amazing and affordable food, great customer price and beautiful decor.  This location is a WIN!

So I ate it Red Robin recently for the very first time... I have to say I was not only impressed with the customer service I was equally impressed with the quality of the burger and the fries..... the burger was so delicious and simple.... I definitely will be back

I was not happy today with the service.  It took forever to get our orders out and when I received mine it was completely wrong,  I had to ask the server for a new bun and the avocado I asked for.  I don't think I'll be coming again, overall bland food and disappointing service .

Definitely not coming here again after this last visit. I always felt like they were changing things for the worst as far as flavor and portions. Not only was the server not attentive  or that friendly but the food was not even good! Mad lover burger was a big let down. "Bottomless fries" is a joke!! 5-8 pieces of fries for Everytime you want more.. to top it off the food wasn't even hot.

I used to really like this place but haven't had very good luck lately  I had the big BBQ burger which came with all the fries you can eat , however the fries weren't even good enough to finish the burger wasn't a lot better

I am highly disappointed. What is the point of ordering an appetizer if it's going to come at the same time as your entree does? Not just that but we didn't even get napkins until 3/4 into our meal having to ask them. I bet you anything if we never asked for napkins we would have never gotten them. I would like to come to a restaurant with napkins already ready and an appetizer minutes before the main course. Why was I rushed in all this process to eat my food? I couldn't enjoy it whatsoever. HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED! UPDATE: There is 2 of us here we ordered more fries and our waitress had the audacity to bring 1 basket of fries with only 10 fries on there? Are you serious!?!?!?! Some kind of bottomless. WAY TO GO RED ROBINS!

Felt a little neglected. Hard to get one refill for bottomless fries. All 4 of our menus were sticky and falling apart. The self pay kiosk was sticky and dirty. Service was pretty slow.  Food was good though and seating in the bar was comfortable and a lot more quiet than regular part of the restaurant. Nice comfy red upholstered cushiony chairs. Too many burgers to choose from. I say get rid of half of them then perfect the ones left.

I was recently going to try Res Robin like I always have, but then as I was walking in I noticed a letter on the window that you should never see. As most restaurants have the nice blue A posted as their health grade, Red Robin had a big red C! How do you score a C on a health inspection?! The lack of cleanliness and hygiene this place had to have to score a C which is one letter from closure will be my reason for never coming back to this establishment at this location!

Red Robin was really great today. Tasha was a great waitress, quick with our order and friendly. I had the A1 peppercorn burger and sweet potato fries. Definitely feeling like I got my boyfriends moneys worth.

The food is good. It can get very busy toward the middle of the day and during the weekends. It is located inside the Antelope Valley Mall so it's easy for shoppers to get food. The parking is difficult, especially if you just want to  go to Red Robin to eat and not necessarily go shopping, says I avoid it sometimes for that reason. However, if you are craving the endless steak fries, plan it out so you have an early lunch. They open at 11 am and it's not busy at all during that time, although it fills up quick.

Went to this place for family dinner. We asked for the booth because we have toddler and we were told booth is not available although there's five empty booth around us.  We did not argue. Here the food came and it was burned. I asked the waiter about it and the waiter said, he will ask the cook if he can make a new one for me. I don't understand why they even served the burned bread from the beginning. They served the new one when we are about to pay.  Not happy with the service. I talked to the front and she said she will let the manager know and that was it. So I don't even think if this was even brought up to the manager.
I am a repeat customer to this location. Nick is the best server! He's seriously good at what he does. The food is always on point and the restaurant is always clean.
This place is a mixed bag when it comes to service, some days really good, other days you wonder how some of these people possibly got hired but overall its decent and the food is good.

We were seated quickly, since it was a Monday and only 11am, but the service was terribly slow. Even our drinks took a long time. The fries were stale, though hot? And the spinach tortilla for my wrap was also hard and stale. Well below my normal expectations for a Red Robin.

I normally love Red Robin I'm here now actually and the service is terrible Vanessa I think is her name she's rude slow, incompetent seeing as everything on my salad that I didn't want was put on there, were here around 7 barely got all of our food and the order was somewhat correct and it's 830 now

Terrible customer service. The hostess was rude, no smile, nothing. She was young with dark brown long hair in a pony tail. Our waitress was also rude, she just wanted to get her shift over with. Black hair, red lipstick, and tattoos in the cocktail section.

Came to eat with friends and have a good meal. We placed orders and waited 45 minutes for 3 burgers.  Ridiculous!  We were not even checked up on or given an update about anything until I decided to ask how long it was going to take for our food to be brought out. Food came and didn't have a choice but to eat after waiting so long.

Had an amazing experience today for lunch. Christie was the BEST waitress EVER. She was very perky, happy, and attentive w/ a  jolly attitude. Customer service was at a 100%. Christie should be promoted as Manager. She has the quality & personality. Promote her please!!!!!

They served my daughters SIDE SALAD IN THE BASKET the Burger was in. Not on a plate like most places do. The waitress gave it to us that way. The other waitress laughed and said, I think the cook might be new. When I Left, I laughed too. Here is a Nickel for the dumbest dining experience I have ever had in the A.V
Melanie at red robin is the best! She made sure i was hooked up and not dry  Buffalo wings are ridiculously delicious

I love the fries here with the honey mustard sauce. Not only is the food awesome here, the fries are endless!!!! Its also at the AV mall so after shopping and walking around, its a good place to sit down and chill.
First thing I noticed was the bar tender not using tongs for the cherries and limes. Gross! then she took for ever to even acknowledge the ziosk machine. Whatever. Small tip.

The food is really good! My favorite is actually the cobb salad, not really into red meat. But it never fails to he one of the best salads ever! The service is always good, I love all the waiters and waitresses here

With this crazy life lived in fast forward, it is hard to get time out with the hubs for a date night, but we managed this weekend! We went to Red Robin because I was craving a really good burger and we were treated to just that. We both had really well crafted burgers and drinks. But THE BEST PART of the evening was Christie. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, incredibly responsive and just all-around amazing! She asked the right questions, anticipated our needs and gave us the perfect space to enjoy our time together. Thank you Christie! We will be back and asking for your section again soon!! 04/09/2017, 3:49 PM, Table 40/1, Guests: 2 (20039)

Food was yummy and cooked in good time. Went there for promotion lunch for my grand daughter and 8 others. Awesome server! He definitely deserves 5 stars. He brought the food hot and was friendly and constantly checking and if in that area again I would go back there.

Received awesome service from Sonny first of all, my drink never got low, my fries were fresh, table of 7 and didn't skip a beat good job to Sonny! I got the black and bleu burger which was amazing!!! I paired it with some seasoned steak fries and an ice cold brew! Makes for a great dinner!!!

My daughters daddy took her to Red Robin and I decided to tag along with them. I have not been here in a long time and I was hoping for good food like I remembered. I got the patty melt and it was delicious. My daughter got the pizza from the kids menu. She killed it. My reason for 4 stars is the wait. Please don't come hungry the wait is horrible. Service was great we got a very friendly waitress. Will be back and maybe next time I will get something completely different.

I love the service in the bar area.  The bartenders are awesome and quick to respond to your requests.  The food is good, fresh and consistent. Really love that the bar area is adults only seating.  I love kids, but when I'm not with mine, it's nice to have the screams on the other side of the glass wall.

Red Robin is one of my favorite places to eat, and this particular location has always rated between 2 to 5 stars, depending on the day.  My family and I have been here numerous times over the years and we plan to return again, always with the hope of visiting during a 4-star or a 5-star day.     On the best of our visits to this location every aspect of our visit was enjoyable, from the cleanliness of the restaurant to the pleasantness of the staff, and most importantly to the quality of our meals.  When this place is at its best it is very difficult for other restaurants to compare.  The difficulty is, of course, to consistently achieve this rating for every visit.   For the purpose of providing constructive criticism for the management here, and for potential customers, I will now clarify on four of my disappointments over this last year:  (1) My kids' meals have consistently been exceptional, but on some occasions (about one quarter of them) my meals have only been mediocre, from a cold meal to a burger with a noticeably unripe pineapple. (2) The restaurant is usually quite clean, but the bathroom is often less than acceptable.  One example is when I recently entered with my young son and it wreaked of marijuana smoke from a previous visitor.  It was sickening to the point where we had to quickly leave the second we possibly could.  The restrooms also may get visitors from outside the restaurant, outside of the mall, so restrooms should be monitored for cleanliness more frequently than other Red Robin restaurants.   (3) On rare occasions, I have had an unfriendly waitress or hostess.  One example is when the waitress would not make any small talk with me or even make eye contact, and it was unusually awkward, especially in a sit-down restaurant where communication, customer interaction and friendliness are crucial.   I've had this waitress more than once, and had the same experience each time (so it wasn't simply a bad day). But again, this is rare, since all our other waiters and waitresses were totally awesome.   (4) I've always loved the atmosphere at all Red Robin restaurants, but some of the recent changes, at the executive management (national) level, have been rather disappointing.   One example is the recent logo/sign change that was made, from the exciting "Red Robin" highlighted above the door in neon lights to the current and boring sign with light-red lettering on a dark-red background.  This was an unwise decision made at the national level, and unfortunately this particular Red Robin location now must conform to this poor decision for consistency.     Once again, I plan to return with my family, with the hope of having a 5-star visit, which I know can occasionally be delivered at this Red Robin.  I can navigate around the one poor waitress.  I'll just try to ignore that dull and boring Red Robin sign out front.

Came here with my sister today because she was craving red robins nagging me until I woke up. We entered, were greeted and seated right away. I haven't been to this red robins in quite awhile but it looks like they remodeled it a bit.  Our server was fairly nice he immediately came to our table after being seated to get our drink orders. About 5 minutes later he came back to take our orders. We got the shorty o-ring tower, black and bleu burger and royal red robin burger. Our food came out really quick which I was kind of impressed about. The onion rings were delicious nice and crispy just the way we like it. My sister enjoyed her Royal red robin burger a lot. I on the other hand felt my black and bleu burger lacked flavor and was kind of dry. At first look it visually looked delicious but when it came to actually eating it I was disappointed. My buns were really soggy idk why the burger wasn't that juicy and the mushroom cuts were way to big to compliment the burger plus there were only two slices.. I had high hopes for my meal but it just didn't meet my expectations at all which weren't high to begin with. Would recommend not getting the black and bleu special burger because like $14 not worth it.
Food was amazing! Server Paulina is the best there is would definitely come again just for her service.

The California chicken sandwich was okay; fries were okay; my son's pasta was bland.  Service was satisfactory.  For the sports fan like me I wouldn't come here.  Of the 6 TVs I saw here, 5 were showing the exact same game on the exact same channel....the next game came on and all the TVs stayed the same.....yawn!

Great services!!!!! Since we got here the waitress was really helpful. She made sure there was nothing missing in our table. The restaurant was clean restrooms are great. They have royalty program. You earn free food and sometimes you get discount.
Server was nice but food was lukewarm. Too hungry to return. Bottomless fries were not bottomless. Cold too

I went in yesterday because I wanted a gourmet burger, but instead I got blah! The burger was not seasoned and the fries were sad and boring. It took forever to get seated (at 2pm). The guy from the bar had to go and seat us. The look of all the hungry patrons should of been my second clue to leave.  Needles to say, if you want a gourmet burger then don't come here. You are better off eating at 5 GUYS. For some strange reason, this is the only Red Robin that I've been to that sucks!!!! Hey management, time to do so thing about this. BTW: bottomless fries?! The server never asked me if I wanted more of their sad depressing fries. Ugh! I want my tip back!!!

I understand when you're a large having to wait a little bit but being told the wait was 20 minutes then 40 minutes later still waiting to be seated. Not a good start. Then when I ask the hostess she was snotty in the way she told me she was seating us right now....Once they finally got us sat we got our order taken after then an hour later we finally got our food. The fries were cold and rubbery. The chicken was warm not hot. The salads were wilted. The chili burger was watery and burned. All in all we were not impressed. The server was a sweetheart and tried her best to work with this hard situation she never lost her patience with my kids and their numerous requests and kept us refilled the whole time.

I had just finished seeing a movie and was hungry. I checked yelp, I kind of forgot about Red Robin being inside the mall but being that I was pretty much right there I walked on over. I arrived at about 1:30 and there were quite a few people inside. I had seen the yelp complaints about wait times, normally that would be of concern to me but I had a couple of hours to kill before I was to meet someone in Lancaster so I entered. I was quickly seated, handed a menu, and my drink order was taken. Along with the main menu there was a one page special menu and on it was a burger called Smoke & Pepper which included Black-Pepper Bacon, Extra-Sharp Cheddar, House-Made Smoke & Pepper Ketchup, and Smoked Sea Salt on a Toasted Ciabatta Bun, this sounded good and I ordered it when the server returned with my drink. I decided to time how long my order took, after reading some of the yelp comments I was expecting a bit of a wait. 6 minutes later the burger was brought to my table, 6 minutes! And this was during the lunch rush! The burger was very good, cooked the way I like with just a hint of pink at the center. The black pepper bacon and smoke and pepper ketchup gave the burger a bit of a kick. I cleaned the plate, I was asked if I wanted more fries but that would have been overdoing it, I know my limits. I was extremely happy with both the food and the speedy service, I would happily return to try some of the other burgers.

I'm very disappointed in the "new" Red Robin. Our server was Nichole M and she was terrible. If she brought refills at all, they were the wrong ones. I asked her about an ingredient and she gave me a really bad attitude and acted like I was dumb. The best service we got was when someone else was helping her. She didn't ask us if we wanted more fries (we did) and she didn't ask us if we wanted dessert (we did). She just shoved the check at me before we were even finished.  But tonight is a new low. We have a tradition of going to Red Robin on my daughter's birthday because I was in labor with her when I ate there. Tonight was the last time we will ever go there again. I informed the host (who looked VERY young) that it was my daughter's birthday. While we were there, they sang to another couple so I know they DO sing for Birthdays. But not my 13 year old?? Um, no thank you. We are very much done.

I've never had a problem here before, but apparently to-go orders are too difficult for them...We ordered four entrees and a side. Yes, we probably should have checked the bag before leaving, but after waiting around 30-40 minutes, we expected a place like this to get the order correct. After getting home, we realized that an entire entree was missing. This was not the fault of the person who took our order because it rang up correctly, but someone screwed up.

Came in on a Sunday around 6pm. The place was pretty busy but was still able to get a table within 5 minutes (that's with the whole family- six of us).Our waiter was pretty good. He didn't come back every second but also didn't forget about us which was pleasant. The food was great. We all got different burgers and everyone commented how good their food was. Also the onion rings were the bomb.

Being a franchise restaurant there is nothing really extraordinary about this place.. it's a Red Robin, you come here for an Onion ring tower, some drinks, a burger and some unlimited steak fries and leave. Its better grub than the stuff you can get at the food court and probably faster than eating at Claim Jumper.

You can redecorate all you want and this place is still a train wreck. We thought since our last visit of 3/6/2016 that perhaps with a new look that maybe they would of improved. We go in and the hostess and it's about 5 p.m. was snotty and had no personality. She started to take us to the back of the restaurant when we noticed a window seat so we politely asked for that. She gave us a put upon look at sat us there. We waited about ten minutes for service and nothing so we saw some gizmo on the table pressed the button for waiter and still nothing. Finally a waitress comes walking by so we stopped her and said we have been here for a long time and don't even have a drink yet. She said wait a minute I will see who your server is. Still nothing and then finally some guy comes out and starts talking to the table next to us with chitter chatter. SO we got up and left. He likely was our server and did not even bother to see what happened. This place is no better than it even was. What a shame ! to bad that the management is terrible and the servers learn from the example.

"Red Robin YUM!" As the old commercial slogan suggests, this place of food and libations always deliciously delivers. The Red Robin franchise survives because of the quality customer service and the fact that their burgers kick *ss and come with bottomless fries (plain, garlic parm, sweet potato) or broccoli as a healthy alternative. Palmdale's Robin roosts right in the mall area, making it convenient to dine at. Their service was excellent (thanks Nicole, you were awesome) and the food was delicious....Mm mm mm BURGERS!  *This Red Robin seems to be getting a remodel, yet it is open during this time. Some may look at the atmosphere as a bit of an eye sore, but it's no biggie and the food makes up for it.

Honestly, My family and I like Red Robin's having a young child and we didn't have a bad experience with them until today. I order their veggie burger but when it got to our table it had BACON on it! Our waiter never came by to ask about our food. I ended up having to remove the bacon off myself! Not the best thing in the world for a vegetarian! Top that off with that waiter not coming around to ask about refills or to receive our extra shake cups we had asked for!

Went in on a Friday  afternoon, the place was not pack yet so I thought great I'll be in and out....the hostess tried to put us a dirty table at first there was a cup on it still and crumbs so I was like no can u put us in a different  table so she did...was seated by the hostess and told by the hostess  that my server would  be with us shortly.....we waited for 5 minutes  no one so we waited 5 more and still no one not one single server acknowledge us...at this point I'm like hell  no let's leave....I'm  very disappointed  with the customer  service  never will I come to this red Robin in the mall....I've never had an issue  with them until yesterday  so bummed because I  did visit  this place on a regular....

negative zero was there with family 4/23/2017 with a party of 12 I never seen anything like this before as were siting at our table close to the kitchen about 5mins after are food arrived to our table we see a huge black RAT run pass are table after we called a manger over he reaction is like oh ok , assumes he's seen it before are someone has told him , not for one second he was shocked never apologize for what happen all he asked was which way it went I'll have some one get it ; yuck the guys he got was the cooks from out the kitchen never again will I eat here I'm just so shocked on how much business they make and the can't afford exterminator ... I def will be contacting  HEALTHY DEPARTMENT
This place has seriously improved! Food is amazing! My Chicken came out perfect! It didn't look burned and rubbery! Kudos to the new management team!!

Five stars because the service was excellent! Our server, Nick was superb! He was attentive, friendly and very accommodating. The mushroom burger was also very good. My sweet potato fries were good, but they were a tad on the lukewarm side. Again, Nick was amazing!

This place is always hitting the spot. Whether it's chicken strips or burgers, we always have a great experience. The service is great and the waitress/waitresses are always giving us the best service they can. "Reddddd Robinnnn, YUMMMM" Lmao.

I feel like this place used to be a lot better than it is now. The food is mediocre. Last time my son and I went on a Friday night, he ordered a cheeseburger from the kids menu. The cheese wasn't even melted. I wasn't very hungry and just got soup and salad. The salad was okay, but the soup was pretty bad. I had the chicken tortilla (at the suggestion of our sever) and it was watered down. Just not very good food all the way around. :-/

This was my first time at this location and now remember why I do not frequent Red Robin more. I'll start at the beginning... Parking is not easy to find due to this location is in the mall. Ugh... Went inside and it seemed like it was nice sized location. Staff seemed friendly but extremely busy which can be good and bad at the same time. I suppose it depends on if you are in a hurry or not. I ordered a bowl of chili and my husband ordered some type of burger wrapped in lettuce with an extra patty. We didn't order anything extravagant but I wasn't impressed with either. Red Robin is known for their burgers and bottomless fries but I don't see what's so great about their burgers. If I want frozen, not fresh burgers then I would rather eat fast food for a bit cheaper. There seems to be a lot of families that frequent this location. Kids galore so if you are looking for a somewhat quiet burger place then this is not a viable option. Cleanliness was pretty decent for being as busy as it was with the amount of kids that were there. Bathrooms were ok as well. Overall, my experience was ok. So many more restaurants that I would rather frequent than this place in the same mall area.

Came here multiple times and each time I come I enjoy it, all of thier food is good and if your getting a hamburger but don't feel like spending to much the tavern double is only 6.99 and is a good sized burger it also comes with unlimited fries. Overall a very enjoyable restaurant.

Disappointing My wife wanted to come here for her birthday.  We were immediately seated and the waiter took our drink order.  I could not decide whether I wanted a soda or an adult beverage so I told the waiter, "I'll have a water for now." After what seemed a reasonable amount of time, our drinks arrived and the waiter took our food order.  The kids ordered their kiddie meals; the wife and I order different burgers.  At this time, I order a soda as well. When our order arrived, my soda didn't.  I told the waiter this.  He apologized and left to get my soda.  Our children had no problems with their meal.  However, when my wife and I started to eat our burgers, we discovered they were raw and barely cooked.   We waited for what seemed like forever for the waiter to return with my drink.  When he did, we told him about our raw burgers.  He apologized and said, they would remake them. By the time our remade burger had arrived, our kids were finished with their meal.  I took a bite into my burger and found it cooked to the opposite extreme.  It was well past well-done and more like a piece of carbon.  We were done complaining.  We finished what we could of our meal, paid our bill and left.

Went for a nice dinner with the kids the food was great except the server Kelsi gave my food to the wrong table ! Ounce my food came the kids had already eaten and we're ready to go, never checked to see how the food was and she just vanished!  Ask the buss boy for my check and a box he brought the check back and I looked at the receipt and I was charge for two burgers now my bank account is messed up! I'm a server and I love giving good service  some people should  not serve! The manager never came ounce to apologize considering the server blamed him or her for not removing the burger from my check! Bad business!  Food is still good

We've been a few times and each time the burgers were delicious. The service is friendly enough, not overly so but I think it's because each server has a ton of tables. The restaurant is clean. It's always busy but the wait is not usually too long.

I received very poor service here.  The waitress was inattentive, slow and  barely ever checked up on us.  I had to flag her down repeatedly to get her to  bring the already-ordered drinks to my kids.  Then, after a very long wait, the  food finally arrived and my chicken was cold.  I flagged her down again to get a  replacement entree.  When the new chicken dish arrived, it was undercooked and  bland.  Also, my wife was dissatisfied with her meal and the potions on my kids'  meals were small.

Burgers and endless fries are great. Service and staff always take care of you and keep drinks full and fries coming. Gets packed on weekend but lunch during the week is great. Wish they had lunch specials but otherwise really good
I like Red Robin, but today the fries were a little stale.

Burgers here are awesome and endless steak fries are a great deal. I would love to try some more of their burgers! So many to choose from. Service is friendly, but rather slow. Good location In AV Mall!

I'm here now and the bartender Nick is disrespectful. Asked him the cost of a drink since they don't have prices a day he said he didn't know, I asked how is that possible and he said that if I have to ask I'm too poor to afford it. He forgets his job is to serve people, he isn't doing to well which is why I now will never come back to Red Robin. Thanks Nick for the bad experience!

Great food, but the day you visit depends on what kind of service you get. Most of the staff just hangs out in the kitchen talking to each other or on their phones. The food is great when you finally get it, but after you do your waitress is usually MIA until it's time for the check. If you get take out, always check your order their in the restaurant. They haven't gotten one right yet.

Went in for dinner with my kids and a friend and her family, we were a party of 7. We were seated quickly for a large party on a Friday night, despite that it was packed. Took awhile for our server to come over and take our drink & appetizer order and it went all down hill from there. The kids got their drinks but our order from the bar took 20 minutes. The server was very distracted; couldn't remember who ordered what when he served us and drink/fry refills were slow. When my friend's husband asked for cocktail sauce the server said ok, I'll be back to take your cocktail order and never came back. He didn't know what cocktail sauce was! I try to be patient, the restaurant was busy and we were a large party but the quality of the service was below any I've ever experienced in this type of situation.  I talked to the manager, Pedro on the way out and he was beyond appropriately apologetic. Said he wished we had talked to him while we were still dining and I assured him I wasn't looking for a free meal. I wanted to let him know of our experience and that the server's tip reflected his service (as I don't ever feel good about not leaving 20%). He thanked me for my feedback and assured me he would address the problem. The food was good as usual and the manager's response made me feel that this was not par for the course for his restaurant. We will be going back, and hopefully get better service!
Always great! Good burgers, bottomless steak fries! And if you want something healthy the chicken ensinada is delicious! Also tortilla soup is off the hook!

I love Red Robin. I enjoy the food here, and the service at this location is really great I rarely leave disappointed. I never felt like waitress forgot about us, and she was very helpful with any questions we had about things on the menu. Very attentive service.
Great burgers and helpful staff. The bar is a nice place to get a beer if anything. I was asked many times if I had enough fries and beer there.

So yummy for lunch or dinner! Always have very friendly staff. Always very clean! Ambience is very casual plays some decent music always have the sports games playing! The food is always fresh and hot ! Bottomless fries are perfect!

The restaurant was super busy tonight but then again it's a Friday night. Waited over 20 minutes for our food, which only consisted 2 burgers and a piece of chicken. The waitress was nice but very busy as well. Good food,upbeat environment.

My boys wanted to eat here after doing some shopping. I didn't feel like a burger so I got the Whiskey Rio BBQ salad which was a sad sad salad. I know salads are not too exciting but when I have gone to other places the salads are good with fresh lettuce and plenty of toppings. This one was some lettuce, little bit of onions on the side a piece of chicken and avocado on the side, don't remember tomatoes, limes or parsley as stated on the description. BBQ sauce and ranch were on the side, usually the dressing is mixed into the salad. The plate was the size of the salad so it was hard to mix all the ingredients together.  After we left I realized they didn't give me the garlic toast as also stated on the description. Cost of this sad salad was $10.49 :(. I buy the BBQ chicken salad from trader joes for $4 and it is much better. No drink refills offered. We also ordered a side of fries no refills offered either. When the waiter came around it seemed like he was in a hurry and briskly walked by while asking how was everything. Sons order was wrong but he said he would just eat it and didn't want me to ask for another since they took a while the first time around. This was during lunch and they were not busy. My other son ordered the chicken strips which came with 3 measly fries on the side.  When I asked for 3 to go boxes you would think he'd know to bring a bag, I mean how I'm suppose to carry 3 boxes along with my shopping bags. This is not the first time we've had bad service at this location. Why pay for a mediocre meal along with bad service and feel like you are a bother.  I like red robin burgers but will not be coming back to this location no more.

Our food was very good and our waiter joshua G. was nice but wreaked of smoke and took forever to get our drinks.  It took more then 25 minutes to get our food, and he kept forgetting to bring us fries the check, drinks, and boxes even though we asked several times. He would also disappear several times, my guess a smoke break

This is a great resturant and and I believe the building says it's a bar also I have never had a bad expierence here actually it's quite the opposite ...someone commented  about paying a lot for a long island . First of all I have never payed that much for a long island in my life I know for a fact that they are $8 and if I did order one I would know that there is a lot of sweet and sour in that drink to begin with and if I was unhappy with something  that i ordered I would send it back and they would replace it free of charge not finish everything and then complain about it .
Just had dinner here, even with the Black Friday traffic our server Joey was amazing and made our dinner extremely enjoyable, very pleased, our food was great and our drinks were even better

I have always loved eating at red robin, but this time was the best experience me and my husband has ever had. Our server Joey was extremely efficient,  polite, and made our experience a great one!! Thank you Joey and whoever his manager is needs to give him a raise. He goes above and beyond to provide great service!

I come here almost every Sunday for lunch.  Andrew and Allison are really great servers that really go out of their way to provide excellent service.  The variety of burger types is the typical for red robin, and the quality of the good is as should be expected from a professional chain. The restaurant is usually clean and the wait for seating is rarely long, if you have to wait at all.  It's not as fancy as some of the other red robins I've been to, but that didn't detract from the quality burgers and good service.  If you want a decently priced burger that you can fully customize workout having to go out of town, this is a great place for it!

I'm not a huge fan of Red Robin in general but I have to say the people on our visit this day handled it pretty well.  Bunch of amped up soccer girls after state tournaments and their parents, should spell nightmare but our waiters were super prepared and super accommodating. Cant say I love their food but their fries with seasoning are always a thumbs up in my book.

Worst service ever, guess the waiter was not in the mood to help us.  Only checked on us once throughout the whole meal.  Usually have a nice time there but I guess it was the whole I'm here to work and nothing else.  Will prob not be back anytime soon.  Thanks for making red robin one less place to come have a meal at.

Yuck, Zaggats gave this #1 best burger (I will never trust Zaggats) Burgers were skimpy, (Bacon) I should have ordered extra patty ($2.00) Service was OK, although they botched my order. My Wife and Son got the burning Love burger, said is was kinda bad. Fries were luke warm. Red Robin must be totally profit driven nowadays. They used to be good a few years back.  Fosters, In-n-Out , even Carls Jr. is better. I felt ripped off, I would Avoid !!

Me and my friends went and had a horrible experience. We had to wait for our food for over an hour and the people who came in before us even got their food before us. It was horrible and the waiter didn't even come to check on us.
Looove the frys and they have the best burgers!!! Good kids choices and great location. They also have excellent lower calorie options.

Went back again last night it was busy 5 parties ahead of us yet we got a table in less than 5 minutes, food was great, drinks were great, waitress in the "Bret Favre" jersey was great, rockstar Ali from last trip stopped by to say Hi...I had to lower the star rating BECAUSE I CANT BELIEVE HOW DAMN FILTHY THE PLACE IS, WHY!!! We got a window seat again there is black sticky finger prints all over the window sills right at eye level, if you bump the walls with your elbow they stick, carpets so dirty, booth fabric literally has black lines across where body parts touch just so dirty when they do everything else right its a shame.

What happened to Red Robin??  This used to be a reliable corporate chain restaurant that I'd go to with friends and family but I think that yesterday will count as the last day I will ever go to the Red Robin in the Antelope Valley Mall.  In fact, given the shrunken menu, I don't think I'll bother with Red Robin anymore. The menu used to be interesting with many, many more choices than is offered now.  The menu is probably less than half of what it was.  It doesn't help that my favorite entrees have been chopped.  No more Tuna Foccacia sandwich.  No more wild salmon sandwich.  BOOO!  Instead, just a bunch of soggy burgers and deep fried boredom.  You'd think that with less of a menu to worry about, whoever's cooking it would do a good job.  Guess again. My companion didn't finish all his salad because he thought the luke warm chicken tasted suspicious.  I tried a piece and it tasted way over seasoned and over processed.  Yeah, you'd better not eat that.  My burger, a swiss cheese and mushroom job, was soggy and luke warm as were the french fries.  It tasted as though it had been made in advance and shoved under a not very hot heat lamp.  Our server disappeared and I made the mistake of eating half the burger before calling it quits.  I've never had such poor food at any Red Robin before and, for me, one bad experience of anything in most cases is enough for me to cut my losses and never return.  There would have to be some redeeming quality for me to continue to waste time/spend money.  Why keep punishing yourself?  Luke warm stodgy food is one of those things that is definitely unforgivable and, in the end, may have made me sick. The place was empty at the time of day I visited which is unusual.  This place used to be packed.  Now, they have just a couple of servers and the food takes longer than you'd expect to arrive at the table.  This could be down to the economy which would explain the condensed and boring menu and the lack of patrons.  Maybe I just visited on an off day but the lack of customers tells me differently.  The lack of customers could also be due to the fact that there's a Claim Jumper and a newish Yard House just up the way which is where we should've gone with everyone else. Red Robin are pushing a 'Red Royalty' customer reward card.   There was a time when I would've requested a card with the plan to use it in the future.  Now, I don't think I'll ever go back.  Time to move on and see what else is out there in corporate chain land because it appears that Red Robin and its bare bones menu are done and there are other places where I can enjoy a decent meal I believe. Two stars only because of misty tuna foccacia memories plus our server was friendly.  Minus the friendly server and I would only rate the food I received yesterday at ONE STAR.  Food should never be served luke warm.  AWFUL.

Food is good and vegetarian optioms.are suprisingly good. Beware that late night service isn't so good. Basically, you have been given food and one drink and that's enough. Good luck with refills! Otherwise, good place to eat.

Love this place. So simple and easy. I always get there crispy chicken burger with extra pickles. Sometimes my bf and I get an appetizer. Last time we got the pretzel bites, which were great... But I asked for an extra side of cheese, and then they told me its 1.19 for a tiny side of nacho cheese. Seriously the size of maybe 3 bottle caps. So that erked me. But anyway I just won't get that again.
Great spot for a burger. The service is excellent. The strawberry lemonade is to die for. I would highly recommend the mushroom burger. You won't regret going. Prices aren't too bad

This Red Robin is a bit hit-and-miss.  It's usually great: good food, excellent prices, and great service.  However, sometimes they're VERY understaffed and the service is unacceptably slow.  I'd give them five stars if they could get their act together and be consistent with the service. I strongly recommend the Natural Burger for those looking for a calorie deal.  It's about half the calories of their other burgers (547) and is absolutely delicious.  Order it with melon instead of fries for a healthy alternative. If you're not looking for a calorie reduced option, the bottomless drink list is long and includes root beer floats!  Also their Mud Pie is huge and delicious.  They have a variety of happy hour specials at the bar, too.

I generally enjoy going to RR for dinner and drinks, but was pretty disappointed with the service I received a few days ago. My friend and I went here for dinner and a beer, excited to hang out because it had been awhile since we had seen eachother. When my friend ordered her beer, the waitress was rude to her, questioning her as to why her ID was bent, as if she wasn't of age to drink. After the ID situation, she continued to give me an attitude because I wasn't ready to order when she would come to our table. The waitress ended up telling me to flag her down, which I don't find to even be slightly professional in a restaurant. Our food was good, which is pretty typical for Red Robin. I ordered & split the bruschetta chicken sandwich & bottomless fries with my girl friend, and it was yummy as usual. Definitely recommend. I will be returning to RR, but will definitely ask for a different waitress if I come across her again.
Delisious food and a nice environment located in front of the mall just the wait sucks.

Went in with my boyfriend to grab a decent meal since we had long days and didn't wanna cook.. And we haven't been disappointed with red robin in the past granted I haven't been to the one in Palmdale in years so we ordered our food it came to us only to find out that the re-fried their old fries to serve to us they tasted awful. I'm not one to complain usually but it's not that hard to fry up new fries especially since my boyfriend is a cook he knew right away and so did I they really tasted horrific neither of us ate them nor did we want more so, so much for "bottomless" steak fries people would actually want to eat. I was so disappointed and their burgers weren't that great either they were left sitting in the window for sometime before we even got them. I don't know what happened to this place but we will not be returning I'm sadden that we wasted our money on what I thought would be a decent meal like it used to be. The freckled lemonade was the best part of that meal.

The times I have visited where always good, the service has felt rushed a bit of times but the food is delicious and I just love unlimited fries. The drinks where also really good and the environment is very friendly.

My husband and I come here quite a bit, and we always have a good experience. Really good burgers, especially the Whiskey River BBQ and the Red Tavern. We tried a new one yesterday, the Southern Comfort, which was really good! The fries are always awesome, and the fact they give you an unlimited amount is really nice. They have great Thousand Island dressing for dipping. I have to knock our location for two minor things. First, it's in a mall (not their fault, but I hate malls!). Second, we do takeaway quite a bit since we have small children, and they made mistakes with our order the last two times. It's been the same mistake two times in a row, and my husband said what he wanted three times, but it was still wrong. He asked for the Red Tavern burger with the large single patty,and they keep giving him the one with two smaller patties. Now, it was still really good, but they might want to fix that problem.
This place needs a makeover! So run down and the staff seems to be so bothered you are there.  3 stars because I like the burgers.

Had to go to the AV Mall and get my sunglasses "in about an hour" you know the place. Any how and hour+ to kill. We headed on over to Red Robin. We started out with the large tower of onion rings. Yeah we killed it but then I was worrying about when the Fish and Chips we ordered came. I know Red Robin is known for their burgers but if you want something different try their Fish and Chips. Onion Ring Tower almost gone! Stella half gone. Here come the Fish and Chips. Four good size pieces of cod in a golden batter on top of a bed of fries. HEAVEN! Service was great, super fast very impressed. We just love the fact that you can get such quality food at a place with such a casual atmosphere. The ONLY place we will get Fish and Chips now. Thank you everybody.
Food was great with my Bug and service is always outstanding at bar. Our bartender Nick is fun,efficient and witty along with repeat checking on us...
First time going there me and my wife for her birthday had a wonderful time good service good food and love   Rob the bartender he the best I will be back soon thank y'all so much.
Best hamburger I've had in a while. Great service also. Four stars just because the beer I asked for could've been colder.

The food here is always good. The same thing goes for the service. I've never had an issue with having my order messed up. Try to avoid the dinner rush so you don't have to wait long. Even the times I had to wait, it wasn't more than 10-15 minutes.

My children really like Red Robin, so when I received a coupon through my email, I decided to go for dinner. I showed my coupon to the waiter, but when I received my check, the discount wasn't there. The waiter went back and forth looking for my red robin account through differant phone numbers, but wasn't able to find an account, so they told me I couldn't get the discount. I asked him to talk to manager, because clearly, I have a coupon that was sent to be by Red Robin. The manager, Pedro,  actually said there wasn't anything he could do without my account. Seriously! We're talking about a $4.00 discount. It was pure principal at this point. Your company sent me a coupon, you need to honor it! The waiter was great, and tried helping us. I just couldn't believe Pedro would not honor a coupon that his company sent. Seriously your willing to lose a customer over $4.00. Very frustrated, and removed my email from there mailing list, they don't honor the coupons anyway!

This is my second review for here. I love coming to this place. The atmosphere is upbeat and the food is great. Today, was a different story. I walk in to put my name down and there is an argument between a lady and the host. The lady was claiming racial discrimination. The host, Lucy, acted like she really didn't care and didn't want to talk to the lady. She just told her that the manager was coming. When the manager showed up, the lady explained what happened. The manager also acted like she (as a customer) did not matter. I never heard him apologize. He said he could get her seated, but her party had already left due to the situation. I still hadn't been able to put my name in. A guy walked up behind me and met with a waitress (I'm guessing they were friends or family). She put their name in and jumped everyone in line waiting. After I put my name in, I watched the waitress let the host know that she had a table opening and that it was specifically for that party she had put on the list. I don't think this was right. She shouldn't be able to jump the line and get people in faster than the people who had been waiting. The service I saw, before I even got seated, was terrible! Once seated though, our waitress was on top of everything! No time waisted! Thank you for your great service Layla! Also, the cupcake milkshake is awesome!

I'm not new to eating at Red Robin.  Placing our order wasn't a problem and neither was getting our food.  After we were done eating, our bill was brought to the table.  It took me less than 2 seconds to place cash in the envelope but almost an hour for anyone to pick it up.  That was amazing.

The food is good! The waitress we have was fantastic and friendly. My only suggestions switch breadcrumbs onion ring to beer battered. Throw away French fries been around more than five minutes every order should be made fresh. On the table was a little electronic screen besides offering appetizers to order directly you can play videogames to passes your time, my wife played for three minutes gave up because the questions were too easy. On the bill there was a $1.99  entertainment charge, there's no warning about being charged if you continue. It is a shame red Robin steal money from their customers.

Okay, so everytime I come here this place is amazing! Neat, great vibes by the workers, and my food always comes out amazing! This is my favorite spot to be when I come to the Antelope Valley. I wouldn't change this place for any other place! Oh, and there new burgers! Mmmm Mmm Mmm! Yummie!
This place was super chill the food was good. This is a perfect place for family's outings and good for birthday dinners and date nights. I will be back!
This is my regular spot when I'm not in the mood to experiment with new places. I always order a burger or the fish and chips. Oh and a glass of Guiness! Best price and food at the mall.
Always a perfect place to take my girls to ( wife, 7 year old and two year old). Quickly seated and always fast and amazingly amazing service. Can't say enough good about this establishment ;-)

Red Robin has always been my favorite restaurant until recently.  I have been going to this location for well over 10 years and something serious has changed. Ever since the remodel the food has been BAD.  I love the DGB and have gotten it many times.  Since the remodel, they are hit or miss on putting any of the garlic ailoi on and last time I went the bun had so much flour on it it was inedible.  Had to go through 2 drinks to try and get it down.  Decided to try a salad last time since the DGB was hit or miss and it was wilted and gross and didn't have avocado like it was advertised.  Since I was still hungry I ordered the chocolate fruffles and took one bite and sent them back.  They tasted HORRIBLE.  What happened guys? Please go back to the good service and quality you used to offer.

Horrible service with Ana we even had to switch waitresses Nicole was awesome ! They were have the two for $15 and a very nice host sat us down and told us the two for $15 was for everyone she even brought us a flyer, when the waitress Ana came she did not want to give us the deal and she was giving us the worst attitude so I asked to speak with the manger I think his name was Mathew he seemed whatever about it and just gave us another waitress but Nicole was very nice Ana needs to smile more and be nicer to customer and if she was so sure that the two for $15 was for royalty members only she should of asked when we kept saying it was for everyone.

I get that it's Saturday and it's busy but I was not checked on once! On top of that I had to stand to call the waitress over to ask for more fries for my little brother and literally received his fries right when I was tired of waiting and asked for the check and had to ask for a to go box since they took so long. I love the food but was extremely disappointed with the service.. Gave a 3$ tip... Go to BJ's

My husband and I are very frequent visitors of this Red Robin.  My husband has a garlic allergy.  We ALWAYS note the allergy so the "kitchen" will not season anything.  Today, the order came with seasoning on the fries.  Due to cross contamination the entire order needed to be remade.  2nd order came with seasoning on the fries......again. Luckily my husband caught the scent before he ate anything or we would be spending our evening in the ER compliments of Red Robin. I ate about 3 bites of my burger but at this point both of our appetites are ruined.  The "manager" apologized and removed only my husbands order from our bill but he was more than happy to clear away my uneaten food.  Our server, Vanessa, was so nice and understanding.  Usually, we request Paulina (but she had the day off), she NEVER lets the kitchen get our order wrong.  This mistake could have been a disaster.  We will NOT eat here again.

Love love love the onion rings the fries are steak cut also my favourite. Burgers are good not mind blowing but better then just about every where around here but I will always come for the onion rings !!

Went there with my fiance and had some bad service at the bar area. The bartendar girl was not on her A game. Maybe she was sick or something but definitely not good. We had to wait forever for menus ( even after we asked)... we had to ask for more beer, we had to wait forever for our food....like I said I hoping she was just under the weather...
In love eating here with my family great food and for the most part great service. I love the new up dated look very retro . I also love their drink menus soooo delicious

I feel like I give a lot of 5 stars, but I always see the good in establishments. Unless it's a truly horrible experience. The location was under construction during my visit but you can tell the place is coming together nicely. My server was super nice and helpful. She was thorough when taking my order and returned to check up my mother and I several times.  The menu has been updated with all sorts of tasty gourmet dishes. I wanted to try one of the new signature burgers but I did think $13.99 was a little steep. Opting for a regular bacon cheeseburger was just as good. Speed of service, quality and quantity were all lovely. All in all 2 full meals and a beer for $30 wasn't to bad. Thumbs up!

They have a huge variety of delectable burgers -- that's a fact!! But they also have some fantastic soups and salads to choose from, You can get a bowl of chili or mac and cheese -- and they also have some entree plates, such as ribs or fish. or chicken. I have never had any problems or bad experiences at any Red Robin. They are very attentive and always offer to refill beverages or fries!! I also appreciate the Full Bar option.
Overcooked burgers, very dry.  Not sure what the issue was, but all the food was just a little off from regular Red Robins.
Glendale is an awesome host! If you eat here request Paulina as your waitress and Sonny as your waiter, they are the business! And let's not forget about the bottomless fries!

If they had a zero to rate this location, I would use it and they would deserve it.  First, the remodeling is terrible.  What used to be a nice, quaint atmosphere is now open, bright and just odd.  The art work is strange with a bunch of old 8-track tapes arranged in a grid with an "Uncle Sam" overlay -- do these two things really make sense mashed up? They had no bacon for their bacon burger and no onion rolls.  The server said that the management was not too sharp and it shows with glee.  The server was fine but the place itself has gone downhill. Also, the new remodel did not leave much room for handicapped people as I saw one go by that had a very hard time maneuvering the narrow byways -- nice to be looking out for the physically challenged Red Robin! Lastly, the silly Ziosk tabletop "toy" cost our party an extra $1.99 when someone accidentally hit the wrong button to pay for games for which we did not intend to purchase.  I found it annoying that it was constantly flashing ads in my face as well. I don't go to Red Robin much, but it will now be reduced to zero. Perhaps the owner's dull witted friend or family member who engineered this remodel nightmare can go and degrade more places and alienate more customers.
Ashlyn helped our team (group of 20) get in and out between games (in an hour) and was amazing.  Food was good, orders were all correct and service was top notch.

My family and i are frequent Red robin visitors.. Its one of our favorite restaurants but the one out here in the AV mall is horrible. Thought we would give it a try yesterday. We ordered the whisky river wraps,fries,and 2 strawberry lemonades.. First our spinach tortilla for the wrap was rock hard. Our fries were burnt, you could probably throw one at the wall and it would stick in it like a knife. And only one of us got a refill on our drinks cuz nothing else was offered. We paid almost 5 bucks per lemonade with bottomless refills sooo wheres our refills, why are our fries empty without a replacement? The refill i did get was missing the strawberries completely. So he was just to lazy to make it?? The last time he walked up was to just say you can pay your check on that little gadget on the table and that was it.. I wanted to say ummmm were thirsty! Wheres more fries! Why did we even come here to pay for sh*t service but i was just done and over it.. Thank you red robin for ruining our dinner

Been here many times and the burgers are very good.  My personal favorite is the Sautéed Shroom Burger, add bacon.  Yum!  Throw on a draft beer or a margarita and you got a party!  I've also had the Fish and Chips that was quite good.  Burgers are the food of choice tho!

Anna was awesome! Fries were endless and the burgers never disappoints. I had the smoke and pepper burger! I have had other that were better but I must say this one hit the spot. Put it down with a good Logger and you got yourself a good pair. You can never go wrong with Sweet potato fries  especially when they keep them coming!

My favorite little go to place. The Pros are they have good burgers, not expensive, great Rewards. Cons are some of the waiters such as Anna and one more I cant remember her name..The men are better waiters than the women
the chicken was so dry and scraped up the top of my mouth, they gave me like 10 fries at a time and service was slow af

Make sure you sign up for their red royalty card to get free items....no server ever told us, we had to see the sign for ourselves outside the restaurant, and miss out on free stuff for God knows how long...I think the servers should tell customers about them. So we asked Robert about them today and he was more then happy to help us out. Nice guy, great server! Yummy food

Normally my family has excellent service here but our last visit was HORRIBLE! Three stars is being generous! Poor service and waiting over 30 minutes for our meals, then being told their computers were down so we didn't get credit for three meals on their rewards program. Computers worked just fine when it came to charging me for the meal. Although we like the food we probably won't be back. Why pay for poor customer service?!? Poor service: After placing our order our server did not stop by once aside from dropping off drinks. No check in or explanation on why we had no food. Finally I asked for a manager and we eventually received our food. You would think we would see our server after that but she still did not stop by. No drink refills. No fry refills.

Someone needs to train the bimbos at the front desk.  There were 4 of them fumbling over two iPads.  There were so many empty tables and between all of them, they still quoted a 15 minute wait.  We asked about the empty tables and they looked at us as if we were speaking a different language.  They were worthless, unfriendly and un-welcoming. It's a shame because Red Robin puts out good food.

It's Red Robin. The burgers are great, the location inside the AV Mall makes it easy to get in and out of, and the servers are super good at their jobs.  I was in recently with an aquaintance, and I swear she was going to give the waitress a stroke with special requests and just being an over-all obnoxious customer.  As a matter of fact I thought I was gonna crawl under the table out of embarament . The waitress just took it all in stride, served out meals with a smile, and had to sort out my goofy dining companions payment. While I will NEVER EVER eat out with her again, I will certainly be returning to Red Robin over and over again for my "Burger fix"! What a wonderful and truly professional waitsaff!
Great food and bottomless fries. It was busy due to the fact it was spring break, but I can't complain!

We have been to Red Robin multiple times, and have never been disappointed. Stopped by with the family the other day and had another great experience. Now that we have five in the family, we always look for kids friendly restaurants, and Red Robin is one of those places. They have a great kid's menu and they all love the food. My wife and I tried a couple gourmet burgers. She loved her Prime Chophouse burger. The Smoke & Pepper was also good, especially if you are a fan of bacon. Amother great thing is that they have happy hour all day every day, so I guess you can call it "happy day." A tall glass with dinner really hit the spot. The wife went with the margaritas, and they didn't disappoint. Endless streak fries is something that you can't get anywhere else. My dipping sauce of choice is their honey mustard sauce, with kicks any Ranch sauce's ass with ease.  We will definitely be back for more, Red Robin....yum!

I was seated and when I asked the waitress for the beers on tap, she gave me attitude. I asked her the prices and she said she didn't know. I asked her if she could find out for me and she stormed off without a second glance. She then sent a second waitress to tell me the prices and I ordered. When my food arrived, the spinach artichoke dip was cold so I flagged her down and asked her to heat it up more for me. She then snatched it from my hands without a word. When my meal arrived, the burger I ordered was cold. I was so over it at this point that I didn't complain anymore to her. I will not be returning! Horrible customer service and care of food!

This is one of our regular places. We love the baja chips and dip and the onion rings for appetizers. The burgers are wonderful. The drinks are yummy. We just love this restaurant. We always leave full and happy. But by far, the bottomless fries with camp fire sauce is the best! Yum!!!

I have been going to this place for years and I love it. One of my most favorite part about this place is the French fries. They're so good!! They are big and soft too. And love what they did to the scenery..

Pains me to do this...my family, which consists of me and the wife and three young kids, would come here at least once a week.  The food was always good, the service was always good, the kids would be entertained with the decorations and the game console at the table, mom and dad could relax and enjoy a meal...but, the last few times we have come here, it has been a totally different experience.  Keep in mind, due to us having young kids, we come for dinner at 4:00ish to beat the rush and it is typically fairly slow...so you'd think the service would be spot on...not so much.  From the hostess to the server, the service is so slow.  And keep in mind, this is NOT during the dinner rush.  No one even has the decency to even say "hey, sorry, I know we are a little slow.  I'm new..." or whatever...but instead, you are literally left without being checked on for at least 15 minutes at a time...at least.  We have seen multiple people just walk out...sometimes it's people waiting for a hostess to even come to the front to seat them.  It really has gotten to the point where it is flat out ridiculous how bad the service is...one time we were there for thirty minutes at our table before not only placing a drink order but even being acknowledged!  I've seen a few new faces in there so I'm not sure if that's what the problem is but either way, it's kinda doesn't matter...it's extremely bad.  I hate to be "that person" but we are no longer going to frequent this establishment.  We will try applebees as our family's outing once a week.

The food was good, but they were a little light on the guacamole on the guacamole bacon burger. The restaurant was clean and the associates were very nice and accommodating. Overall it was a great experience.

Came here with a friend on Saturday evening.  The place was packed but we were seated in under 5 minutes.  Our waiter was at our table within 2 minutes of being seated and took our drink orders.  He returned quickly and took our dinner order.  Like I said, they were very busy and the waiter apologized in advance if our order took a bit longer than usual to arrive. That makes all the difference! He even brought us some fries to hold us over until the food arrived.  Also, any time our drinks were about to empty, our waiter was there with a refill.  As usual, the food was great.  I got the cluck and fries and my friend got a newer item from the healthier section.  We both enjoyed our dinners.  I always have a good experience at Red Robin.  Professional staff, prompt attention, and excellent food.

Well this was an interesting experience. For starters, the restaurant was nowhere near busy right at dinner time. Then we are asked how we want our burgers cooked, We ordered the Rare Whiskey River Burger and the Medium Rare Fiery Ghost Burger. Sadly what we got were two burgers made from shoe leather with no pink to be found. I am sure the meat was lean, because these were anything but juicy. And while the burgers on the menu looked appetizing, what we both got looked like McDonald's cheeseburgers, flat and unimpressive, and not even as tasty. If you want a good barbecue burger, go get a Whiskey BBQ burger from Carl's Jr.  Then there were the fries, which by pale in comparison to Five Guys right down the street. Ok, I'm done with my rant... Won't be going back there again.  Whiskey:  Fiery Ghost:
Best Red Robin I been to staff super nice even the Manger was super cool. If you want burgers in Palmdale eat here.

I haven't been her in so long. Christine our server was a hoot. She made our visit really fun.  I like to change up my burger and she was all for the changes and it was perfect! Cold beer in a bottle and she brought me a glass half way thru my beer, the way I like it! Ken liked his burger too.  There wasn't much talking at our table with the spinage and artichoke dip we started with. Very yummy!
The best gourmet burgers I'm coming here again ... They also have a full bar!!! Oh and friendly servers!!!! 3 stars because it takes awhile for them to get the food ready....

Nothing like having your taste buds set get home and your order is wrong. I asked for  a black and blue not this nasty burger with a smudge of blue cheese and onion strings on it. Not happy one bit. They should read your order to you when you pick it up. Gas is to high to return it.

It was about the same as any other Red Robin I've been to, but everything was slow. They didn't seem that busy, but nobody even came to take our drink order for almost 10 minutes and we were discussing whether to just leave soon. After that, things went a little faster but not by much.

Burgers are great. But they take their time making them. Like figure 15 - 30 minutes to get anything, you order. Love their bottomless fries hate bugging waiter, to get me more fries. Seems like he has to go to Idaho, to get them. Food is good but expensive, service is often mediocre.

Food and environment is very good!!! Service was ok, I know it was busy night but I expected a little more. We ordered water (along with other drinks) and never got the water until we asked 2 more times for it. When we did get refills got the wrong soda back. Never got side of fruit for our child, didn't see server much at all.

The burgers and fries here are great. They're not amazing but for what you're paying for most of the time they're worth the price. They have a solid diverse menu. My service was horrible and she would never come around us to we couldn't even ask her for anything we needed. We had to ask the busboy and other servers for things we needed since she stayed away from us like the plague. She never checked in with us. But the food was good so hopefully you don't get the same waitress as I did.

I'm still waiting for a resolution ....No....I'm not waiting for a resolution. That will never happen. I can't even get a response! This restaurant as well as the ...NOT ONE BUT TWO different corporate employees as well as the owner did NOTHING but email me asking me for the SE thing....My phone #!! Unprofessional & Careless.

After getting some shopping done at the AV mall, my hubs and I decided to grab some burgers at RR. Even though it was lunch time and pretty busy, we only waited a few minutes before being seated in a two-seater booth.  Despite being busy, our waitress was on point and very quick with our orders. I was disappointed to see my fav. chicken sandwich was no longer on the menu, but I decided to order the crispy chicken with mustard instead of mayo. The sandwich was pretty big and by time we got our food, I was starving and thought I would be able to finish my food, but I was able to eat half of the sandwich and finished the chicken, minus the bread and fixings. Along with the fries, my hubs ordered a side of campfire sauce, which taste very similar to in and outs secret sauce. I was so happy to see a side of ranch (actually two), even though we hadn't told our waitress we wanted ranch.

Had a fantastic dining experience this evening! Didn't know that I had a Free Birthday Burger tonight when my son and I arrived. We ordered Guacamole Burgers, and we finished them with the "Endless Fries." Our server Marco was attentive and Atmosphere lively, folks happy, talking and conversing. Temperature Cool, we'll air-conditioned as 102 high today in Antelope Valley. Very busy this Friday evening, and restaurant staff all friendly and upbeat, with guests flowing in and out of establishment. Nice place to dine and escape the Desert Heat.

I'm pretty bummed about the recent remodel. While it looks nice, their prices for the food have staggeringly gone up. Me and my family loved to eat here, usually twice a month. Our bills were always about $35 with a tip. Due to the remodel and the price increase, our bill today was $42 with a tip. My burger and fries favorite go-to item went from 7.99 to 9.99 with no additions for my benefit. Seriously? That's a crazy price jump.  I love their burgers and the servers have always been super accommodating. However I think we'll be eating here far less in the future. The Habits burgers are just as amazing, far less pricey and I don't have to tip cause it's fast food. I think we'll be going there from now on and save some $$!

We hardly ever visit Red Robin, the few times we have been here food and service have been mediocre, and that is probably why we don't frequent this place but tonight was very different. Our server nick kept the laughs rolling with his sarcasm and humor seriously hard to find a good server nowadays.  Food was excellent!!! And this is huge for me since I'm a hard to please person. I had the smoke and pepper signature burger, I added grilled onions and jalapeños and it was freaking delicious. My bf had the whiskey river BBQ burger and he was very pleased with it.  Very happy with this visit, we will be back.

Christie is an amazing server! Thank you! She made me feel welcomed & well taken care of. The burgers are delicious I had the gourmet cheeseburger with a side of mixed fruit easily 5 stars from me. Also, I highly recommend their shakes.

We frequent the Palmdale restaurant and have been Royalty members for a few years. The kids working the hostess station were busy and weren't as friendly as usual, but not in any way rude. We always sit in the bar unless we're with guests that have children. This particular Sunday we both ordered regular "no frills" bacon cheeseburgers and fries. We had our favorite server, Joey who is always professional and down to earth. No scripted responses. I hate scripted responses! He never writes the order down and never forgets anything. Food was exactly as ordered and tasted delicious! We run the gamut when we dine here and have tried everything from the gourmet burgers, fish items, pastas, sandwiches and chicken dishes. It's always consistent and fairly priced for the amount of food you receive. I like that you have a size option on the wine (6 or 9 oz.) and the beer choices are plenty. I'm giving 5 stars based on my visit to a chain burger restaurant and satisfaction of our meals.

I usually really enjoy everything I get here but tonight was really disappointing. The guacamole burger was underwhelming to say the least. The fries were dry and my burger had noooo flavor and I'm not looking forward to another visit to this place.
great beer, burgers are bomb make it ghost style with fried jalapenos.. endless fries, ginormous shakes.. had a bloody mary did the trick for my hangover

Came here for lunch yesterday. The service is always fabulous. I had the bleu ribbon burger this time. It was so big, I had to take half of it home. The bartender is always so sweet, the waiters never let you down. This is our go-to place for when we are being mall rats.

Normally Red robin's service is anywhere from OK to good however, after we placed our order which was for just 2 burgers and fries....it took almost 45 minutes for us to get our food.  plus we never even got apology for the excessive time it took.

OMG....PLEASE...PLEASE stay away from this place...it...is...AWFUL!!!!! The service is sooooo slow.  We were seated and our drinks didnt come till after our meal was brought to us by another waiter....and we had to ASK for our drinks.  Rediculous. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwhich and when I got it...it was DRIPPING with grease....seriously?  When do you need that much oil to grill chicken?  It had so much oil I used a napkin to hold it. To make matters worse when we were finally done, I gave the waiter my credit card to pay, because we knew we wouldnt see him again for another 20 mins....he eventually came back with just a slip to sign showing that they had charged me $40 some odd dollars.....No actual receipt....I have NO CLUE what I bought!!!   lame awful service.....go to Texas Cattle Company on the other side of the mall...You will save yourself a LOT of frustration.

I usually come to this red Robbins a lot but my most recent visit was disappointing. When we first got there they sat us down very quickly but then waited for our waitress to even ask if wanted drinks for about 6 minutes as she came and took our drinks it took her another 7 minutes to bring them as we had to ask a table cleaner for them or if they were coming. Food this day was mediocre, wasn't fresh. Also with there bottom less fries I asked another waitress for some and basically she ignored me and never brought any so asked another waiter and it took him a while so we finally seen our waitress and asked her and she brought some along with the other waiter bringing some at the same time. So overall the staff has poor communication and by the time they brought them we just weren't in the mood anymore. Also we were basically so thirsty we were chewing on our ice because she never asked to refill to then end.

Good food, but I wouldn't call it a burger place, it's hardly ever done right. Service is usually fast, and fries are amazing. They don't do the best burgers in the world, but the chicken is very good.
Just ate dinner here ask for Ally she was great best service we have had in a long time.

Awful service. Arrived at 4 pm and the place was maybe a quarter full. I could see 10-15 open tables and we were told by the hostess that there is a 10-15 minute wait so the servers could get caught up. I thought she was joking but apparently not. Left and will not be eating there again.

Not such a good experience for us--lots of empty tables but a 25 min. wait--understaffed?  Ordered burgers &  one came with"endless fries" (though never asked if we wanted more--which we wouldn't have since they were soggy & limp).  The burger patties were very, very  well-done--leathery & not tasty at all.  The other burger came with a "fruit salad"--a chopped up bruised apple with a half can of mandarin oranges poured over it--had been sitting a while as the juices were a little rancid.  Did not feel well the day after probably due to the warm mayo or the fruit salad.  Service was slow.  Will not be back in this lifetime.....

A hang-out spot for me and my friends a couple of years ago.  Their food was always above par and their service was decent enough.  Not amazing, but decent.  If the service were to be bumped up, I'd add another star or two, but until then, three stars for the food and decent service.

The food was great! Though the service sucked. Everything was awesome until after we got our food. My wife and I's drinks were empty and had to wait about 10 minutes until another server was able to help us. Our server was too busy keeping the other 2 tables happy and totally forgot about our table.

Good food but poor location.  Seated promptly, and quickly ordered appetizers and beverages.  Our dinner came quickly and the food was pretty good.  It wasn't the greatest hamburger we had ever had, but it was pretty good.  Despite being located in a main entrance in the mall, I will definitely go back again.

I can't believe that I am the first person to rate... Anyhow, great burgers! Probably as good as they get here in the Antelope Valley (please let me know if I can find better burgers nearby). They have bottomless fries, which my kids love. Their chicken pasta is pretty good too... Their Pulled Pork BBQ sandwich was delicious... um, what else... oh yeah, they have bottomless refills on strawberry lemonade with real strawberries (which I don't drink because it's too sweet for me), but my hubby gets it every time. Overall, it's really good. I wish they had more variety for kids (with food allergies).
